intro: Podosemum porteri, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive, fragrant scent. Podosemum porteri is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
